sub_title: Experienced Pricing Analyst and Business Support Manager
summary:
I am a Business Analyst with more than 20 years experience in an international environment. My responsibilities include P&L management, business planning, financial reporting, cost forecasting, pricing and profitability analysis and SAP master data analysis. My field of experience within a global organisation is diverse and i am comfortable operating and communicating at all levels. 

For my hard work and professionalism i was one of 25 colleagues recognised globally by Chevron as being a high performer. I was invited to the Chevron Head Office in the U.S. where i was presented with a "Chevron Pride Award".

In July 2012 i completed a full-time Dutch language course at Nijmegen University. I have subsequently taken the Dutch State Exams and have achieved passes in Listening, Writing and Speaking in Dutch.

profile_positions.description:
Was invited back by Chevron to take up the position of Business Analyst - Master Data to support a Europe/Canada SAP Roll-In project. Reporting to a manager in London and a technical team in The Philippines.	
•	Worked closely with the "business" to assess which customer master data fields could be directly migrated to the new ERP system, which fields needed prior cleansing and identified where new data needed to be gathered.
•    	Responsible for developing tools, defining processes and creating documents required to support all phases of the project, including mapping tables, Customer Master Data definitions and governance instructions, training documents and SOX Compliance validation forms. 
•    	Coached resources assigned to the prepping and cleansing of master data, regularly checking output to ensure data was accurate and of a high quality.
•    	Facilitated meetings and discussions with key stakeholders as required to meet project deliverables (Sales, Tax, Finance, Credit).
•    	Travelled on multiple occasions to the Philippines, spending a total of 3 months in Manila during an 18 month period, working with the Conversion Analyst to validate transformation outputs.
•    	Provided transitional support throughout the go-live period and trained Customer Master Gatekeepers in the importance of maintaining correct and consistent data.
•    	Remained in the business for a further 5 months to support the European and Export customer service team during the stabilisation period.
profile_positions.title: Business Analyst - Master Data - Europe/Canada SAP Project

profile_positions.description:
Held the new position of Pricing Analyst within the Marketing and Merchandising department of Office Depot at their European headquarters in Venlo.
•	Worked on an ongoing basis with Business Intelligence team to extract data from internal reporting systems to create pricing analysis reports.
•	Held bi-monthly meetings with Category Managers to discuss price analysis findings and identify areas for profitability improvement.
•	Responsible for increasing gross profits by providing data and tools to enable the Merchandising team to make informed pricing decisions for more than 10,000 diverse products, in 5 different countries, via multiple sales channels such as the internet, catalogue sales, contract sales and telephone sales.
profile_positions.title: Pricing Analyst - Benelux, Germany, Austria and Switzerland

profile_positions.description:
Fulfilled the role of Pricing Analyst within the Marketing department, reporting to a line manager in South Africa.
 - Coordinated the successful roll-out and maintenance of a new pricing tool (strategic pricing simulator) across the EAME region.
 - Analysed sales results and identified opportunities to optimise profitability.
 - Forecasted future cost moves and calculated future profitability versus business plan.
profile_positions.title: Pricing Analyst - Europe, Africa and Middle East
